summary.overview: The Timetable Generator application allows users to create and manage a weekly timetable by entering subject details, specifying time ranges, and selecting days. Users can view the timetable dynamically updated in a table format.
summary.predefined_options: Days of the week are predefined as Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. These options are presented as checkboxes for user selection.

requirement.description: The 'Subject' input field (identified by data-testid='subject') must accept and display valid text input, including long names and special characters, without truncation or alteration.

test_case:
Feature: User can enter a subject name in the "Subject" input field
  The user should be able to input a subject name into the "Subject" input field, and the field should accept valid text input.


  Scenario: [Normal] User enters a valid subject name
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" is visible
    When the user enters "Mathematics" into the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject"
    Then the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" should display the value "Mathematics"

Feature: User can enter a subject name in the "Subject" input field
  The user should be able to input a subject name into the "Subject" input field, and the field should accept valid text input.


  Scenario: [Edge] User enters a very long subject name
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" is visible
    When the user enters "Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics" into the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject"
    Then the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" should display the value "Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@given('the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" is visible')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the "Subject" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics" into the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the "Subject" input field and enter the text
    subject_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']")
    subject_input.clear()  # Clear any pre-existing text
    subject_input.send_keys("Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics")
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" should display the value "Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Verify that the "Subject" input field displays the correct value
    subject_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']")
    displayed_value = subject_input.get_attribute("value")
    expected_value = "Advanced Theoretical Physics and Quantum Mechanics"
    assert displayed_value == expected_value, f"Expected '{expected_value}', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Hook to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

test_case:
Feature: User can enter a subject name in the "Subject" input field
  The user should be able to input a subject name into the "Subject" input field, and the field should accept valid text input.


  Scenario: [Edge] User enters a subject name with special characters
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" is visible
    When the user enters "Art & Design: 101!" into the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject"

test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@given('the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" is visible')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the "Subject" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']"))
    )

@when('the user enters "Art & Design: 101!" into the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the "Subject" input field and enter the text
    subject_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']")
    subject_input.clear()
    subject_input.send_keys("Art & Design: 101!")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for the input to process

@then('the "Subject" input field with data-testid "subject" should display the value "Art & Design: 101!"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Verify that the "Subject" input field displays the correct value
    subject_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='subject']")
    displayed_value = subject_input.get_attribute("value")
    assert displayed_value == "Art & Design: 101!", f"Expected 'Art & Design: 101!', but got '{displayed_value}'"

# Teardown to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

requirement.description: The user must be able to either select or input a valid time using the start-time picker (data-testid='start-time'), in 24-hour HH:MM format (00:00–23:59).

test_case:
Feature: User can select a start time using the "Start Time" input field
  The user should be able to interact with the "Start Time" input field to select a valid time for the timetable entry.


  Scenario: [Normal] User selects a valid start time
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible
    When the user enters "09:00" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"
    Then the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "09:00"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

# Placeholder for the file path
file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the Selenium WebDriver
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    # Load the test page
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    # Maximize the browser window
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)

@given('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the "Start Time" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "09:00" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the "Start Time" input field
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    # Clear any existing value and enter "09:00"
    start_time_input.clear()
    start_time_input.send_keys("09:00")
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "09:00"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the "Start Time" input field
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    # Verify that the input field displays "09:00"
    assert start_time_input.get_attribute("value") == "09:00", \
        f"Expected '09:00', but got '{start_time_input.get_attribute('value')}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Teardown to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

test_case:
Feature: User can select a start time using the "Start Time" input field
  The user should be able to interact with the "Start Time" input field to select a valid time for the timetable entry.


  Scenario: [Edge] User selects the earliest possible start time
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible
    When the user enters "00:00" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"
    Then the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "00:00"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_given_page_is_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    # Load the test page
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    # Maximize the browser window
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load fully

@given('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible')
def step_given_start_time_field_is_visible(context):
    # Wait for the "Start Time" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)  # Ensure visibility before proceeding

@when('the user enters "00:00" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"')
def step_when_user_enters_start_time(context):
    # Locate the "Start Time" input field
    start_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    # Clear any existing value and enter "00:00"
    start_time_field.clear()
    start_time_field.send_keys("00:00")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for the input to register

@then('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "00:00"')
def step_then_start_time_field_should_display(context):
    # Locate the "Start Time" input field
    start_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    # Verify that the displayed value is "00:00"
    displayed_value = start_time_field.get_attribute("value")
    assert displayed_value == "00:00", f"Expected '00:00', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for assertion

# Cleanup after tests
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    # Close the browser driver
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@given('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the "Start Time" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "23:59" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate the "Start Time" input field and enter the value "23:59"
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    start_time_input.clear()
    start_time_input.send_keys("23:59")
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "23:59"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Verify that the "Start Time" input field displays the value "23:59"
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    displayed_value = start_time_input.get_attribute("value")
    assert displayed_value == "23:59", f"Expected '23:59', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Teardown to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

test_case:
Feature: User can select a start time using the "Start Time" input field
  The user should be able to interact with the "Start Time" input field to select a valid time for the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Edge] User enters an invalid time with out-of-bound minutes
  Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
  And the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible
  When the user enters "12:78" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"
  And the user clicks outside the "Start Time" input field to trigger validation
  Then the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "12:59"

Feature: User can select a start time using the "Start Time" input field
  The user should be able to interact with the "Start Time" input field to select a valid time for the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Edge] User enters an invalid time with out-of-bound hours
  Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
  And the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible
  When the user enters "29:35" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"
  Then the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "23:35"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

# Background setup
@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_given_timetable_generator_page_loaded(context):
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@then('close the browser')
def step_then_close_browser(context):
    context.driver.quit()

# Scenario: [Edge] User enters an invalid time with out-of-bound hours
@given('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" is visible')
def step_given_start_time_input_field_visible(context):
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)  # Ensure the element is interactable

@when('the user enters "29:35" into the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time"')
def step_when_user_enters_invalid_time(context):
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    start_time_input.clear()
    start_time_input.send_keys("29:35")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for the input to process

@then('the "Start Time" input field with data-testid "start-time" should display "23:35"')
def step_then_start_time_should_display_corrected_time(context):
    start_time_input = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='start-time']")
    displayed_value = start_time_input.get_attribute("value")
    expected_value = "23:35"
    assert displayed_value == expected_value, f"Expected '{expected_value}', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for validation

requirement.description: The user must be able to either select or input a valid time using the end-time picker (data-testid='end-time'), in 24-hour HH:MM format (00:00–23:59).

test_case:
Feature: End Time Selection
  The user can select an end time using the "End Time" input field.


  Scenario: [Normal] User selects a valid end time
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible and empty
    When the user enters "14:00" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"
    Then the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "14:00"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the Selenium WebDriver
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    # Load the test page
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    # Maximize the browser window
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)

@given('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible and empty')
def step_impl(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Wait for the "End Time" input field to be visible
    end_time_input = WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']"))
    )
    # Ensure the input field is empty
    assert end_time_input.get_attribute("value") == "", "Expected 'End Time' input field to be empty"
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "14:00" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"')
def step_impl(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Locate the "End Time" input field
    end_time_input = driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    # Enter "14:00" into the input field
    end_time_input.send_keys("14:00")
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "14:00"')
def step_impl(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Locate the "End Time" input field
    end_time_input = driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    # Verify that the input field displays "14:00"
    assert end_time_input.get_attribute("value") == "14:00", f"Expected '14:00', but got '{end_time_input.get_attribute('value')}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Hook to close the browser after each scenario
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_given_page_is_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for the page to load

@given('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible and empty')
def step_given_end_time_field_is_visible_and_empty(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Wait for the "End Time" input field to be visible
    end_time_field = WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']"))
    )
    # Assert that the field is empty
    assert end_time_field.get_attribute("value") == "", "Expected 'End Time' field to be empty"
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "23:59" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"')
def step_when_user_enters_end_time(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Locate the "End Time" input field and enter the value "23:59"
    end_time_field = driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    end_time_field.clear()
    end_time_field.send_keys("23:59")
    time.sleep(1)

@then('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "23:59"')
def step_then_end_time_field_should_display(context):
    driver = context.driver
    # Locate the "End Time" input field and verify its value
    end_time_field = driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    assert end_time_field.get_attribute("value") == "23:59", f"Expected 'End Time' field to display '23:59', but got '{end_time_field.get_attribute('value')}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Hook for cleanup after each scenario
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    # Close the browser driver
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_given_page_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@given('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible')
def step_given_end_time_field_visible(context):
    # Wait for the "End Time" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']"))
    )
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user enters "12:78" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"')
def step_when_user_enters_invalid_time(context):
    # Locate the "End Time" input field and enter the invalid time
    end_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    end_time_field.clear()
    end_time_field.send_keys("12:78")
    time.sleep(1)

@when('the user clicks outside the "End Time" input field to trigger validation')
def step_when_user_clicks_outside(context):
    # Click outside the "End Time" input field to trigger validation
    title_element = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, ".title")
    title_element.click()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for validation to occur

@then('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "12:59"')
def step_then_end_time_field_displays_corrected_time(context):
    # Locate the "End Time" input field and verify the displayed value
    end_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    displayed_value = end_time_field.get_attribute("value")
    assert displayed_value == "12:59", f"Expected '12:59', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    time.sleep(1)

# Teardown step to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

test_case:
Feature: End Time Selection
  The user can select an end time using the "End Time" input field.


Scenario: [Edge] User enters completely invalid time for End Time
  Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
  And the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible
  When the user enters "29:99" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"
  And the user clicks outside the "End Time" input field to trigger validation
  Then the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "23:59"
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_given_page_is_loaded(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to load completely

@given('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" is visible')
def step_given_end_time_field_is_visible(context):
    # Wait for the "End Time" input field to be visible
    WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']"))
    )
    end_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    assert end_time_field.is_displayed(), "End Time input field is not visible"

@when('the user enters "29:99" into the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time"')
def step_when_user_enters_invalid_time(context):
    # Locate the "End Time" input field and enter the invalid time
    end_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    end_time_field.clear()
    end_time_field.send_keys("29:99")
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for the input to be processed

@when('the user clicks outside the "End Time" input field to trigger validation')
def step_when_user_clicks_outside(context):
    # Click outside the "End Time" input field to trigger validation
    title_element = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, ".title")
    title_element.click()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow time for validation to occur

@then('the "End Time" input field with data-testid "end-time" should display "23:59"')
def step_then_end_time_field_displays_correct_value(context):
    # Verify that the "End Time" input field displays the corrected value
    end_time_field = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='end-time']")
    displayed_value = end_time_field.get_attribute("value")
    assert displayed_value == "23:59", f"Expected '23:59', but got '{displayed_value}'"
    context.driver.quit()

# Teardown to close the browser after the test
def after_scenario(context, scenario):
    if hasattr(context, 'driver'):
        context.driver.quit()

requirement.description: The user must be able to select or deselect one or more days (Monday to Saturday) using checkboxes in the 'Days' group (data-testid='days'). The functionality should support selecting a single day, multiple days, all days, and deselecting a selected day. Each checkbox is uniquely identifiable (e.g., data-testid='day-monday').

test_case:
Feature: User can select one or more days using the checkboxes in the "Days" group
  The user should be able to select one or multiple days using the checkboxes provided in the "Days" group. The selected days should be accurately captured and used in the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Normal] User selects a single day
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Days" checkbox group with data-testid "days" is visible
    When the user checks the checkbox labeled "Monday" with data-testid "day-monday"
    Then the checkbox labeled "Monday" should be marked as checked

Feature: User can select one or more days using the checkboxes in the "Days" group
  The user should be able to select one or multiple days using the checkboxes provided in the "Days" group. The selected days should be accurately captured and used in the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Normal] User selects multiple days
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Days" checkbox group with data-testid "days" is visible
    When the user checks the checkboxes labeled "Monday" with data-testid "day-monday" and "Wednesday" with data-testid "day-wednesday"
    Then the checkboxes labeled "Monday" and "Wednesday" should be marked as checked
test_cases.step_code:
from behave import given, when, then
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
import time

file_path = "index.html"

@given('the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded')
def step_impl(context):
    # Initialize the WebDriver and load the test page
    context.driver = webdriver.Chrome()
    context.driver.get(f"file://index.html")
    context.driver.maximize_window()
    time.sleep(1)  # Allow the page to fully load

@given('the "Days" checkbox group with data-testid "days" is visible')
def step_impl(context):
    # Wait for the "Days" checkbox group to be visible
    days_checkbox_group = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='days']"))
    )
    assert days_checkbox_group.is_displayed(), "The 'Days' checkbox group is not visible."

@when('the user checks the checkboxes labeled "Monday" with data-testid "day-monday" and "Wednesday" with data-testid "day-wednesday"')
def step_impl(context):
    # Locate and check the "Monday" checkbox
    monday_checkbox = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.element_to_be_clickable((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='day-monday'] input"))
    )
    if not monday_checkbox.is_selected():
        monday_checkbox.click()
        time.sleep(1)  # Allow the interaction to complete

    # Locate and check the "Wednesday" checkbox
    wednesday_checkbox = WebDriverWait(context.driver, 10).until(
        EC.element_to_be_clickable((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='day-wednesday'] input"))
    )
    if not wednesday_checkbox.is_selected():
        wednesday_checkbox.click()
        time.sleep(1)  # Allow the interaction to complete

@then('the checkboxes labeled "Monday" and "Wednesday" should be marked as checked')
def step_impl(context):
    # Verify that the "Monday" checkbox is checked
    monday_checkbox = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='day-monday'] input")
    assert monday_checkbox.is_selected(), "The 'Monday' checkbox is not checked."

    # Verify that the "Wednesday" checkbox is checked
    wednesday_checkbox = context.driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "[data-testid='day-wednesday'] input")
    assert wednesday_checkbox.is_selected(), "The 'Wednesday' checkbox is not checked."

    # Close the browser after the test
    context.driver.quit()

test_case:
Feature: User can select one or more days using the checkboxes in the "Days" group
  The user should be able to select one or multiple days using the checkboxes provided in the "Days" group. The selected days should be accurately captured and used in the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Edge] User selects all available days
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Days" checkbox group with data-testid "days" is visible
    When the user checks all checkboxes labeled "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", and "Saturday"
    Then all checkboxes should be marked as checked

Feature: User can select one or more days using the checkboxes in the "Days" group
  The user should be able to select one or multiple days using the checkboxes provided in the "Days" group. The selected days should be accurately captured and used in the timetable entry.


Scenario: [Edge] User deselects a previously selected day
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the "Days" checkbox group with data-testid "days" is visible
    And the checkbox labeled "Monday" with data-testid "day-monday" is already checked
    When the user unchecks the checkbox labeled "Monday" with data-testid "day-monday"
    Then the checkbox labeled "Monday" should no longer be marked as checked

requirement.description: When the user clicks the 'Add to Timetable' button (data-testid='add-timetable-button') after filling out the required fields in the form (data-testid='timetable-form'), a new row is added to the timetable table (data-testid='timetable'). The row will display the time range in the first column and the subject under the selected days' columns. If any required field is empty (e.g., data-testid='subject', data-testid='start-time', data-testid='end-time', or no days selected with data-testid='days'), an alert with the message 'Please fill in all the fields.' will appear, and no row will be added. Each dynamically added row has a unique data-id in the format 'timetable-row-{startTime}-{endTime}'.

test_case:
Feature: Add a new row to the timetable table when all required fields are filled and the "Add to Timetable" button is clicked.

  As a user,
  I want to dynamically add a new row to the timetable table
  So that I can see my scheduled subjects for the selected days and time range.

  Background:
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the timetable form with data-testid "timetable-form" is visible
    And the timetable table with data-testid "timetable" is visible


  Scenario: [Normal] Add a new row to the timetable with valid inputs
    Given the user enters "Mathematics" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "09:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "10:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Monday" and "Wednesday" checkboxes under the days group with data-testid "days"
    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then a new row is added to the timetable table with data-testid "timetable"
    And the row contains "09:00 - 10:00" in the first column
    And the row contains "Mathematics" under the "Monday" column
    And the row contains "Mathematics" under the "Wednesday" column

Feature: Add a new row to the timetable table when all required fields are filled and the "Add to Timetable" button is clicked.

  As a user,

  So that I can see my scheduled subjects for the selected days and time range.

  Background:

    And the user enters "11:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "12:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"

    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then a new row is added to the timetable table with data-testid "timetable"
    And the row contains "11:00 - 12:00" in the first column
    And the row contains "Physics" under the "Friday" column

Feature: Add a new row to the timetable table when all required fields are filled and the "Add to Timetable" button is clicked.

  As a user,

requirement.description: If a row with the same time range already exists in the timetable, the system will update the cells for the selected days with the new subject name instead of creating a new row.

test_case:
Feature: Update existing timetable row with new subject for overlapping time range
  The system must update the cells corresponding to the selected days with the new subject name if a row with the same time range already exists in the timetable table.


  Scenario: [Normal] Update existing row when a time range overlaps and days are selected
    Given the timetable page is loaded
    And a row exists in the timetable with time range "09:00 - 10:00" and subject "Math" on Monday and Tuesday
    When the user enters "Science" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "09:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "10:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Monday" and "Tuesday" checkboxes with data-testid "day-monday" and "day-tuesday"
    And the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then the existing row with time range "09:00 - 10:00" is updated
    And the cell for Monday displays "Science"
    And the cell for Tuesday displays "Science"
    And no new row is created in the timetable

Feature: Update existing timetable row with new subject for overlapping time range
  The system must update the cells corresponding to the selected days with the new subject name if a row with the same time range already exists in the timetable table.


  Scenario: [Edge] Update existing row when only one day overlaps with the new subject
    Given the timetable page is loaded
    And a row exists in the timetable with time range "11:00 - 12:00" and subject "History" on Wednesday
    When the user enters "Geography" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "11:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "12:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Wednesday" checkbox with data-testid "day-wednesday"
    And the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then the existing row with time range "11:00 - 12:00" is updated
    And the cell for Wednesday displays "Geography"
    And no new row is created in the timetable

requirement.description: When the user adds a new row to the timetable table, the system must insert the row in chronological order based on the start time.

test_case:
Feature: Insert timetable rows in chronological order based on start time
  The system must ensure that when a user adds a new row to the timetable, it is inserted in chronological order based on the start time.


  Scenario: [Normal] Add a new row with a start time earlier than existing rows
    Given the timetable table is empty
    And the user enters "Math" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "09:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "10:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Monday" from the days checkboxes with data-testid "day-monday"
    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then a new row is added to the timetable table with data-id "timetable-row-09:00-10:00"
    And the row displays "09:00 - 10:00" in the first column
    And the row displays "Math" in the Monday column
    And the row is the first row in the timetable table

Feature: Insert timetable rows in chronological order based on start time
  The system must ensure that when a user adds a new row to the timetable, it is inserted in chronological order based on the start time.


  Scenario: [Normal] Add a new row with a start time later than existing rows
    Given the timetable table contains a row with start time "09:00" and end time "10:00"
    And the user enters "Science" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "11:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "12:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Tuesday" from the days checkboxes with data-testid "day-tuesday"
    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then a new row is added to the timetable table with data-id "timetable-row-11:00-12:00"
    And the row displays "11:00 - 12:00" in the first column
    And the row displays "Science" in the Tuesday column
    And the row is placed after the row with start time "09:00"

Feature: Insert timetable rows in chronological order based on start time
  The system must ensure that when a user adds a new row to the timetable, it is inserted in chronological order based on the start time.


  Scenario: [Edge] Add a new row with a start time between two existing rows
    Given the timetable table contains rows with start times "09:00" and "11:00"
    And the user enters "History" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "10:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "11:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user selects "Wednesday" from the days checkboxes with data-testid "day-wednesday"
    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then a new row is added to the timetable table with data-id "timetable-row-10:00-11:00"
    And the row displays "10:00 - 11:00" in the first column
    And the row displays "History" in the Wednesday column
    And the row is placed between the rows with start times "09:00" and "11:00"

requirement.description: When the user clicks the 'Add to Timetable' button (located by data-testid 'add-timetable-button'), the system must reset the form fields to their default state after successfully adding or updating a timetable entry. This includes clearing the 'Subject' input field (located by data-testid 'subject'), resetting the 'Start Time' input field (located by data-testid 'start-time'), resetting the 'End Time' input field (located by data-testid 'end-time'), and ensuring that no checkboxes within the 'Days' checkbox group (located by data-testid 'days') are checked. The reset should occur only if all required fields are filled and at least one day is selected, ensuring a valid timetable entry is added to the table (located by data-testid 'timetable').

test_case:
Feature: Form Reset After Timetable Entry
  The system must reset the form fields to their default state after successfully adding or updating a timetable entry when the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button.


  Scenario: [Normal] Reset form fields after adding a new timetable entry
    Given the "Timetable Generator" page is loaded
    And the user enters "Mathematics" into the subject field with data-testid "subject"
    And the user enters "09:00" into the start time field with data-testid "start-time"
    And the user enters "10:00" into the end time field with data-testid "end-time"
    And the user checks the "Monday" checkbox with data-testid "day-monday"
    When the user clicks the "Add to Timetable" button with data-testid "add-timetable-button"
    Then the subject field with data-testid "subject" should be empty
    And the start time field with data-testid "start-time" should be empty
    And the end time field with data-testid "end-time" should be empty
    And no checkboxes in the days group with data-testid "days" should be checked

requirement.description: Upon loading the Timetable Generator webpage, the system must display an empty timetable table with the following specifications: The table should be located within a <table> element with the data-testid attribute set to 'timetable'. The table must include a <thead> section containing headers with data-testids 'time-header', 'monday-header', 'tuesday-header', 'wednesday-header', 'thursday-header', 'friday-header', and 'saturday-header', corresponding to the columns 'Time', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', and 'Saturday', respectively. The <tbody> section of the table must be empty, ensuring no rows are present with any data-id attributes. This setup ensures that the timetable is ready for user interaction without any pre-existing data.

test_case:
Feature: Display Empty Timetable Table on Page Load
  The system must display an empty timetable table with headers for "Time", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", and "Saturday" when the page loads.


  Scenario: [Normal] Verify empty timetable table with headers on page load
    Given the user navigates to the Timetable Generator webpage
    Then the timetable table with data-testid "timetable" should be visible
    And the table should have headers with data-testids "time-header", "monday-header", "tuesday-header", "wednesday-header", "thursday-header", "friday-header", and "saturday-header"
    And the table body should be empty

Feature: Display Empty Timetable Table on Page Load
  The system must display an empty timetable table with headers for "Time", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", and "Saturday" when the page loads.


  Scenario: [Error] Verify no unexpected data is present in the timetable table on page load
    Given the user navigates to the Timetable Generator webpage
    Then the timetable table with data-testid "timetable" should be visible
    And the table should have headers with data-testids "time-header", "monday-header", "tuesday-header", "wednesday-header", "thursday-header", "friday-header", and "saturday-header"
    And the table body should be empty
    And no rows should exist with data-id attributes
